column2: Expectations have dropped for Nucor's (NUE) first quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Thursday, April 18, 2013. The consensus analyst estimate has dropped from 41 cents a share to the current estimate of earnings of 26 cents a share.The current estimate is down 43.5% from the year-ago quarter, when the company reported earnings of 46 cents per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from 60 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.20 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $5.07 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 9.1% year-over-year to $4.61 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $19.44 billion.For three quarters in a row, the company has seen revenue decline. Revenue in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year fell 7.8% year-over-year to $4.45 billion. The figure dropped 8.6% in third quarter of the last fiscal year and 0.1% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.While the company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, income has fallen year-over-year by an average of 27.8% over the past four quarters. The company was hit the hardest in the second quarter of the last fiscal year as its net income dropped by 62.5%.

Analysts expect higher profit for CareFusion (CFN) when the company reports its first quarter results on Thursday, February 7, 2013. The consensus estimate is calling for profit of 52 cents a share, reflecting a rise from 49 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate has dipped over the past three months from 53 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.15 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 5.3% year-over-year to $843.2 million for the quarter, after being $890 million a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $3.65 billion.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, profit has risen year-over-year by an average of 24.9%. The biggest gain came in the first quarter of the last fiscal year with a 76.3% surge.Revenue increased in the last two quarters. In fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, revenue increased 0.4% to $968 million from the year earlier quarter. In the third quarter of the last fiscal year, the figure rose 6%.The majority of analysts (61.5%) rate CareFusion as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 60.6% buys. Analysts have grown increasingly optimistic about the stock in the last three months.

Mattel (MAT) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Friday, February 1, 2013.Analysts are expecting Mattel to report earnings of $1.15 per share, up 7.5% from a year ago when it reported earnings of $1.07 per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.54 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $2.29 billion for the quarter, 6.3% higher than the year-earlier total of $2.15 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $6.46 billion.Revenue rose year-over-year in the third quarter, breaking a two-quarter streak of declining revenue. Revenue climbed 4% in the most recent quarter. Prior to that, it fell 0.3% in the second quarter and 2.5% in the first quarter.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 0.6%. The company enjoyed the boost in the most recent quarter when net income expanded 21.6%, marking the biggest gain.The majority of analysts (77.8%) rate Mattel as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest five competitors, which average 34.8% buys. Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months. Despite this, the stock price has risen from $36.78 on October 31, 2012 to $36.95 over the past quarter.

Analysts foresee Nucor (NUE) announcing decreased profits on Tuesday, January 29, 2013, when it reports its fourth quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are expecting Nucor to come in with earnings of 29 cents per share, down 21.6% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 37 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 37 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $1.64 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $4.83 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 5.8% year-over-year to $4.55 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $19.56 billion.The company has seen dips in its revenue in the last two quarters. In third quarter, revenue declined 8.6% to $4.8 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the second quarter, the figure fell 0.1%.The majority of analysts (64.3%) rate Nucor as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest nine competitors, which average 27.3% buys. Wall Street has warmed to the stock over the past three months, with the average analyst estimate increasing to moderate buy from hold. Last quarter, eight of 15 rated it a buy and one rated it a sell.

Expectations have dropped for Garmin's (GRMN) first quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Wednesday, May 1, 2013. The consensus analyst estimate has dropped from 43 cents a share to the current estimate of earnings of 41 cents a share.Analysts' estimates are down 6.8% from the year-ago quarter, when Garmin reported earnings of 44 cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has sagged from 48 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.40 per share. Analysts project revenue to fall 6.8% year-over-year to $518.6 million for the quarter, after being $556.6 million a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $2.55 billion.A year-over-year dip in revenue in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year broke a three-quarter streak of revenue growth.. Revenue fell 15.5% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and rose 0.8%in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 6.5% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 9.6% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.Profit has decreased in each of the last two quarters. In the most recent quarter, profit dipped 21.9% year-over-year, and the figure dropped 6.7% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.

Analysts foresee Altera (ALTR) announcing decreased profits on Tuesday, July 24, 2012, when it reports its second quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are projecting Altera to come in with earnings of 39 cents per share, down 40% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 65 cents per share.Despite not changing over the past month, the consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 40 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $1.66 per share for the fiscal year. After being $548.4 million a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 18.8% year-over-year to $445.3 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $1.8 billion.The company has seen net income fall in each of the last three quarters. In first quarter, net income fell 48.3% from the year earlier, while the figure fell 36.7% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and 14.8% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.For the past three quarters, the company has seen revenue decline. In first quarter, revenue declined 28.4% to $383.8 million while the figure fell 17.6% in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year from the year earlier and 0.9% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.

Wall Street is high on Avery Dennison (AVY), expecting it to report earnings that are up 26.7% from a year ago when it reports its first quarter earnings on Wednesday, April 24, 2013. The consensus estimate is 57 cents per share, up from earnings of 45 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate has increased from 56 cents over the past three months. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.58 per share. Revenue is projected to be $1.53 billion for the quarter, 3.1% above the year-earlier total of $1.48 billion. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $6.24 billion.The revenue growth in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year snapped the three-quarter streak of year-over-year revenue decreases. The company reported an increase in revenue by 62.7% in the most recent quarter. Going back further, revenue dropped 12.5% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 11.2% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 10.6% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, profit has risen year-over-year by an average of 30.8%. The quarter with the biggest boost was the most recent quarter, which saw a more than twofold surge.

Analysts expect higher profit for Legg Mason (LM) when the company reports its third quarter results on Friday, February 1, 2013. The consensus estimate is calling for profit of 54 cents a share, reflecting a rise from 20 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past month, from 55 cents, but it's still up from the consensus estimate of 52 cents three months ago. Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.56 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $677.6 million for the quarter, 8.1% higher than the year-earlier total of $627 million. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $2.59 billion.The company's reported revenue has declined in each of the last four quarters. In second quarter, revenue fell 4.4% to $640.3 million. Prior to that, the figure declined 12.1% year-over-year in the first quarter, fell 9.1% in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and slid 13.2% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts think investors should stand pat on Legg Mason, with 10 of 14 analysts rating it hold. Analysts have grown increasingly optimistic about the stock in the last three months. The stock price has increased from $25.48 on October 31, 2012 to $27.99 over the past quarter.

Analysts expect higher profit for Cameron International (CAM) when the company reports its fourth quarter results on Thursday, January 31, 2013. The consensus estimate is calling for profit of 96 cents a share, reflecting a rise from 77 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was $1.08, but is unchanged over the past month. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $3.15 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $2.03 billion by 17.2%, finishing at $2.38 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $8.45 billion.The last four quarters have each brought the company double-digit year-over-year revenue growth. Over that time span, revenue has increased by an average of 20.5%, with the largest growth in the most recent quarter when it rose 31.6% year-over-year.The company's net income has been increasing for three consecutive quarters. In the third quarter, net income rose 35.9% while it rose 18% in the second quarter and 22.4% in the first quarter.The majority of analysts (90.9%) rate Cameron International as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest nine competitors, which average 66.7% buys. Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months.

Optimism surrounds Textron (TXT), as it gets ready to report its third-quarter results on Wednesday, October 19, 2011. Analysts are expecting Textron to book a profit of 31 cents a share, up from 13 cents a year ago.What to Expect:The consensus estimate has risen from 29 cents over the past three months. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.09 per share.Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $2.48 billion by 15.4%, finishing at $2.86 billion for the quarter. Revenue is projected to come in at $11.45 billion for the year.Analyst Ratings:The majority of analysts (90.9%) rate Textron as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 73% buys. Analyst sentiment has been waning recently, as the number of buy ratings has dropped slightly over the past three months.Trends to Watch For:The company has seen revenue grow for three quarters straight. The 0.7% revenue increase brought the figure up to $2.73 billion in the most recent quarter. Looking back further, revenue increased 12.2% in the first quarter from the year earlier and 11.2% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.Dividends:Textron's current dividend yield is 0.4%, based on Thursday's close of $18.07. The company has an annualized dividend of 8 cents per share.Competitors:

Analysts have become increasingly bullish on AES (AES) in the month leading up to the company's second quarter earnings announcement scheduled for Monday, August 6, 2012. The consensus earnings per share estimate has moved up from 22 cents a share to the current expectation of earnings of 26 cents a share.The current estimate reflects a 7.1% decrease from the year-ago quarter, when AES reported earnings of 28 cents per share.The consensus estimate has decreased from 33 cents over the past three months. Analysts are projecting earnings of $1.26 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 5.4% above the year-earlier total of $4.54 billion at $4.79 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $18.81 billion.AES' profit in the last quarter followed losses in the previous two quarters. The company reported a profit of $341 million in the first quarter, a loss of $209 million in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and a loss of $131 million in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.Revenue rose in the first quarter after seeing a drop the quarter before. Revenue rose 11.2% to $4.74 billion in the first quarter from the year earlier. In the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, revenue fell 5.6%.

Expectations have dropped for Apache's (APA) first quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Thursday, May 9, 2013. The consensus analyst estimate has dropped from $2.24 a share to the current estimate of earnings of $2.18 a share.The current estimate reflects a 27.3% decrease from the year-ago quarter, when Apache reported earnings of $3 per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has sagged from $2.30. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $9.09 per share. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 5% year-over-year to $4.31 billion for the quarter, after being $4.54 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $17.71 billion.A year-over-year growth in revenue in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year followed two straight quarters of declining revenue. Revenue climbed 2.2% in the most recent quarter. Prior to that, it fell 3.4% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 8.4% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.While the company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, income has fallen year-over-year by an average of 56.8% over the past four quarters. The hardest-hit quarter for the company was the third quarter of the last fiscal year, in which profit dove 82%.

In spite of an expected dip in profit, most analysts are positive about Corning (GLW) before it reports its first quarter earnings on Wednesday, April 24, 2013.Analysts are projecting Corning to come in with earnings of 26 cents per share, down 13.3% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 30 cents per share.The consensus estimate has declined from 31 cents over the past three months. Analysts are projecting earnings of $1.23 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $1.92 billion by 2.1%, finishing at $1.96 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $8.36 billion.A year-over-year revenue growth in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year broke a three-quarter streak of declining revenue. Revenue rose 13.7% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and fell 1.8% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 4.8% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 0.2% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, but income has been sliding year-over-year by an average of 38.8% over the last four quarters. The hardest-hit quarter for the company was the most recent quarter, in which profit dove 42.4%.

Wall Street is optimistic about priceline.com (PCLN), which is slated to report its fourth quarter results on Tuesday, February 26, 2013. Analysts project a profit of $6.17 a share, a rise from $4.91 per share a year ago.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was $6.19. Analysts are expecting earnings of $29.79 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $1.19 billion for the quarter, 20.1% higher than the year-earlier total of $990.8 million. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $5.25 billion.The last four quarters have each brought the company double-digit year-over-year revenue growth. Over that period, revenue has grown by an average of 25.4%. The biggest boost came in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year when revenue increased 35.5% year-over-year.The company's net income has been increasing for three consecutive quarters. In the most recent quarter, profit increased 27.1% year-over-year. Going back two quarters, net income rose 37.4% in the second quarter and 73.7% in the first quarter.The majority of analysts (72.2%) rate priceline.com as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest seven competitors, which average 41.9% buys. Analysts have grown increasingly optimistic about the stock in the last three months.

Despite an expected dip in profit, analysts are generally optimistic about Altera (ALTR) as it prepares to reports its third quarter earnings on Tuesday, October 23, 2012.Analysts are expecting Altera to come in with earnings of 46 cents per share, down 19.3% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 57 cents per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has increased from three months ago when it was 44 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $1.79 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 7.5% year-over-year to $483.2 million for the quarter, after being $522.5 million a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $1.83 billion.The company has reported falling revenue for four quarters in a row. Revenue declined 15.2% to $464.8 million in second quarter. The figure fell 28.4% in the first quarter from the year earlier, dropped 17.6% in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year from the year-ago quarter and 0.9% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.While being profitable for the last eight quarters, the company has seen net income slip over the past four quarters by an average of 31% year-over-year. The quarter hit the hardest was the first quarter, that saw a 48.3% drop.

Dun & Bradstreet (DNB) is expected to report poor first quarter earnings on Thursday, May 2, 2013 with analysts expecting a 1.5% drop in earnings from a year ago. The consensus estimate is $1.33 per share, down from earnings of $1.35 per share a year ago.The consensus estimate has moved down from $1.45 over the past three months. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $7.47 per share. Analysts project revenue to fall 3.8% year-over-year to $387.3 million for the quarter, after being $402.8 million a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $1.67 billion.The last four quarters have seen revenue declines for the company. Revenue fell 7.1% to $463.1 million in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year. The figure fell 6% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year from the year earlier, dropped 7.9% in second quarter of the last fiscal year from the year-ago quarter and 0.2% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 15.7%. The company benefited from the 36.3% growth in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, which was its quarter with the biggest gain.

Bemis (BMS) reports its first quarter earnings on Thursday, April 26, 2012.What to Expect:Analysts are expecting earnings of 47 cents per share, exactly the same as a year ago. The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 50 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.10 per share for the fiscal year.After being $1.32 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 0.3% year-over-year to $1.32 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $5.34 billion.Trends to Watch For:The company has reported decreasing profit for three quarters in a row. Net income fell 57.3% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year. Going back two quarters, profit decreased 9.1% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 9% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.Analyst Ratings:Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Bemis, with seven of nine analysts rating it hold. Bemis' average analyst rating hasn't changed over the past three months.Competitors:Bemis Company manufactures flexible packaging products and pressure-sensitive materials. One of Bemis' main competitors in the containers and packaging industry is Rock-Tenn Company (RKT). Other competitors in the materials sector include: Sonoco Products Company (SON), Sealed Air (SEE), and AptarGroup (ATR).Recent Price Movement:

The consensus analyst estimate has gone from $1.41 per share to the current projection of earnings of $1.43 per share.What to Expect:Analysts are estimating a 4.4% increase from the year-ago quarter, when Assurant reported earnings of $1.37 per share.The consensus estimate has risen from $1.41 over the past three months. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $5.58 per share.Revenue is projected to be 2.1% above the year-earlier total of $2.04 billion at $2.08 billion for the quarter. Revenue rose 0.3% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and fell 2.5% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 3.6% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 6.1% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.Analyst Ratings:Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Assurant, with seven of nine analysts rating it hold. Analysts have grown increasingly optimistic about the stock in the last three months.Recent Price Movement:

Shares of Microsoft (MSFT) have climbed 10.8% over the last three months to close at $31.08 on April 16, 2012. The company is looking to keep that trend going when it releases its third quarter results on Thursday, April 19, 2012.What to Expect:The consensus estimate is 57 cents per share, up 1.8% from a year ago when Microsoft reported earnings of 56 cents per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from 60 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.69 per share.Revenue is projected to be $17.18 billion for the quarter, 4.6% above the year-earlier total of $16.43 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $73.95 billion.Trends to Watch For:The fall in profit in the second quarter broke a three-quarter streak of year-over-year profit growth. Net income fell 0.2% in the second quarter from the year earlier, while the figure rose 6.1% in the first quarter, 30% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and 30.6% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.Analyst Ratings:The majority of analysts (63%) rate Microsoft as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 59.2% buys. Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months.Competitors:

Wall Street is optimistic about Fastenal (FAST), which is slated to report its first quarter results on Thursday, April 12, 2012. Analysts project a profit of 34 cents a share, a rise from 27 cents per share a year ago.What to Expect:The consensus estimate is has risen from three months ago when it was 33 cents. It hasn't been adjusted since. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.47 per share.Revenue is expected to be $767.5 million for the quarter, 19.8% higher than the year-earlier total of $640.6 million. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $3.22 billion.Trends to Watch For:The last four quarters have each brought the company double-digit year-over-year revenue growth. Over that span, the company has averaged growth of 22%, with the biggest boost coming in the first quarter of the last fiscal year when revenue rose 23% from the year earlier quarter.The company's net income has been growing for three straight quarters. In the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, net income rose 34.2% while it rose 29.1% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 36.1% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.Analyst Ratings:Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Fastenal, with seven of eight analysts rating it hold.Recent Price Movement:

Wall Street is expecting lower profit for Medtronic (MDT) when the company reports its third quarter results on Tuesday, February 21, 2012. Analysts are expecting earnings per share of 84 cents after the company booked a profit of 86 cents a share a year earlier.What to Expect:Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has fallen from 86 cents. In the second quarter, net income rose 53.9%, while the figure dropped 1.1% in the first quarter and 18.7% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.Analyst Ratings:Most analysts think investors should stand pat on Medtronic, with 13 of 25 analysts rating it hold. Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months.Competitors:Medtronic provides medical professionals with healthcare products and therapies. One of Medtronic's main competitors in the healthcare equipment and supplies industry is Stryker (SYK). Other competitors in the healthcare sector include: Boston Scientific (BSX), St. Jude Medical (STJ), and Edwards Lifesciences (EW).Recent Price Movement:

Since October 25, 2011 Amgen's (AMGN) stock has risen 23.2% to close at $69.57 on January 20, 2012. Amgen looks to keep the momentum going when it reports fourth quarter earnings on Thursday, January 26, 2012.What to Expect:The Wall Street consensus is $1.24 per share, up 7.8% from a year ago when Amgen reported earnings of $1.15 per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past month, from $1.25, but it's still up from the consensus estimate of $1.20 three months ago. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $5.29 per share.Revenue is projected to be 2.1% above the year-earlier total of $3.84 billion at $3.92 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $15.51 billion.Trends to Watch For:The company has seen net income fall in each of the last three quarters. In third quarter, net income fell 63.3% from the year earlier, while the figure fell 2.7% in the second quarter and 3.6% in the first quarter.Analyst Ratings:The majority of analysts (64%) rate Amgen as a buy. That percentage is still below the mean analyst rating of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 71.3% buys. Analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.Competitors:

Analysts foresee VMware (VMW) announcing decreased profits on Tuesday, April 23, 2013, when it reports its first quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are expecting VMware to come in with earnings of 46 cents per share, down 2.1% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 47 cents per share.The consensus estimate has dipped from 53 cents over the past three months. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.25 per share. Revenue is expected to be $1.18 billion for the quarter, 11.8% higher than the year-earlier total of $1.06 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $5.22 billion.Revenue has grown by double digits year-over-year for the last four quarters. Over that span, the company has averaged growth of 22.3%, with the biggest boost coming in the first quarter of the last fiscal year when revenue rose 25.1% from the year earlier quarter.The rise in profit in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year came after two consecutive quarters of decreasing net income. In the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, net income rose 2.7%, while the figure dropped 11.7% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 12.9% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.

Leading up to Pall's (PLL) announcement of its first quarter earnings on Wednesday, November 28, 2012 analysts have become more wary as expectations have fallen over the past month to earnings of 66 cents per share from earnings of 69 cents per share.The current estimate is down 10.8% from the year-ago quarter, when the company reported earnings of 74 cents per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from 70 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.12 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $705.6 million, analysts expect revenue to fall 9.8% year-over-year to $636.6 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $2.72 billion.Profit slid in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, breaking a two-quarter streak of rising net income. The 11.4% year-over-year profit decline in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year can be compared with the increases in previous quarters; profit rose 11% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 12% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.Revenue has fallen in the past two quarters. In fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, revenue was $722.4 million, 7.4% lower than the year-ago figure. In the quarter before that, revenue fell 7.3%.

Paychex (PAYX) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Wednesday, June 26, 2013.The consensus estimate is 37 cents per share, up 9% from a year ago when Paychex reported earnings of 34 cents per share.Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.60 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 6% above the year-earlier total of $551.5 million at $586.0 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $2.3 billion.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 7%. It was in the most recent quarter that the company saw the biggest boost, a surge of 17%.For three consecutive quarters, the company's net income has increased. In the most recent quarter, net income rose by 17% from the year-earlier period. Net income rose 5% in the quarter before that, and 3% in the first quarter.Paychex provides comprehensive payroll and integrated human resource and employee benefits outsourcing solutions for small- to medium-sized businesses in the United States.One of Paychex's main competitors in the business services industry, Equifax (EFX), will report earnings on 2013-07-24T00:00:00. Analysts are expecting earnings of $0.90 per share for Equifax, up 22% from last year's earnings of $0.74 per share.

Analysts expect higher profit for Eli Lilly (LLY) when the company reports its first quarter results on Wednesday, April 24, 2013. The consensus estimate is calling for profit of $1.05 a share, reflecting a rise from 92 cents per share a year ago.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has risen from $1. Analysts are expecting earnings of $3.90 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $5.6 billion by 1%, finishing at $5.66 billion for the quarter. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $3.38 per share. Revenue is projected to be 6.5% above the year-earlier total of $1.83 billion at $1.95 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $8.59 billion.The company has posted increasing profit for three quarters in a row. In the most recent quarter, profit increased 3.9% year-over-year. Going back two quarters, net income rose 10% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and 8.5% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.Most analysts think investors should stand pat on Darden, with 14 of 25 analysts rating it hold. Analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.

That rating hasn't budged in three months as the average analyst rating of the stock has remained unchanged.Recent Price Movement:

Wall Street is expecting lower profit for Janus Capital (JNS) when the company reports its third quarter results on Thursday, October 25, 2012. The hardest-hit quarter for the company was the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, in which profit dove 45.8%.

PepsiCo (PEP) reports its first quarter earnings on Thursday, April 18, 2013.Analysts are expecting PepsiCo to report earnings of 71 cents per share, up 2.9% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 69 cents per share.The consensus estimate has declined from 73 cents over the past three months. Prior to that, revenue fell 5.3% in third quarter of the last fiscal year and 2.2% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year year-over-year.

Analysts are projecting earnings of $8.43 per share for the fiscal year. After being $4.92 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 17.9% year-over-year to $4.04 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $17.1 billion.The company has seen decreasing net income for the last two quarters. In the most recent quarter, profit dipped 22.1% year-over-year, and the figure dropped 7.1% in the second quarter.The company has experienced dips in revenue in the last two quarters. Analysts are expecting earnings of $5.46 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $2.47 billion by 7.4%, finishing at $2.65 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $10.55 billion.Revenue has fallen for the past three quarters. The year-over-year drop in revenue was 4.2% in second quarter. Prior to that, revenue fell 3.5% in first quarter and 1.1% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year year-over-year.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, but income has been falling for the last four by an average of 14.2% year-over-year. The company was hit the hardest in the most recent quarter as its net income dropped by 27.8%.

Net income fell 17.5% in the second quarter. Going back two quarters, profit decreased 11.6% in the first quarter and 17.8% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.

Apple reports its second-quarter earnings on Wednesday, April 23, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $10.21 per share.The consensus estimate has risen over the past month, from $10.20, but it's below the estimate of $11.02 from three months ago. Net income fell 8.2% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year from the year earlier, while the figure rose 11.3% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 69.5% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 15% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.

For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $12.38 billion.Revenue dropped year-over-year in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, breaking the three-quarter streak of revenue growth. The 2.5% revenue decline in the most recent quarter can be compared with three quarters prior when it had been rising. It increased 2.8%in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 5.2% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 4.7% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, profit has risen year-over-year by an average of 3%. The largest gain for the company was seen in the first quarter of the last fiscal year, when net income swelled by 15.7%.

Analysts have become increasingly bullish on Sunoco (SUN) in the month leading up to the company's second quarter earnings announcement scheduled for Thursday, August 2, 2012. Over that time span, revenue has increased by an average of 24%, with the largest growth in the third quarter of the last fiscal year when it rose 30.4% year-over-year.Sunoco's profit this past quarter came after three straight quarters of losses. The company reported a profit of $248 million in the first quarter, a loss of $362 million in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, a loss of $1.1 billion in the third of the last fiscal year and a loss of $125 million in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.

NEW YORK, NY - JULY 10: Actor Dwayne Johnson attends the 'Skyscraper' New York premiere at AMC Loews Lincoln Square on July 10, 2018 in New York City. (Photo by Jim Spellman/WireImage)For the last two decades, Forbes has ranked the earnings of the world's highest-paid entertainers in the annual Celebrity 100 package--and in just a few days, the 20th anniversary edition will be released both online and in print.We'll unveil the 2018 Celebrity 100 on Monday morning, complete with a full list of the top-earners--from basketball to soccer; hip-hop to country; Hollywood to to Bollywood and more. If you can't wait to start digging in, never fear. This week, we released in-depth features on two list members: cover star Kylie Jenner and summer blockbuster king Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, whose latest action flick, Skyscraper, comes out today."The number one goal is to create stuff for the world," he explains in the story.Per custom, we will also hold a contest this weekend: enter your predictions for the top ten in the comments section here; the most accurate prognosticator will win a signed copy of 3 Kings: Diddy, Dr. Dre, Jay-Z and Hip-Hop's Multibillion-Dollar Rise (my book on three Celeb 100 veterans and the rise of America's most-consumed genre of music).

Analysts are projecting earnings of $1.14 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 12.2% above the year-earlier total of $1.29 billion at $1.45 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $5.46 billion.Revenue has dropped in the past four quarters. Revenue declined 8.1% to $1.13 billion in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year. The figure fell 10.2% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year from the year earlier, dropped 16.3% in second quarter of the last fiscal year from the year-ago quarter and 20.9% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 34.6%. The biggest boost for the company came in the most recent quarter, when profit jumped by more than twofold.

Despite an expected dip in profit, analysts are generally optimistic about Eaton (ETN) as it prepares to reports its first quarter earnings on Monday, April 29, 2013.Analysts are projecting Eaton to come in with earnings of 79 cents per share, 14.1% less than a year ago when it reported earnings of 92 cents per share.The consensus estimate has risen over the past month, from 78 cents, but it's below the estimate of 87 cents from three months ago. Analysts are expecting earnings of $4.33 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $3.96 billion by 36.9%, finishing at $5.42 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $22.8 billion.The last two quarters have seen decreases in the company's net income. In the most recent quarter, profit dipped 50.6% year-over-year, and the figure dropped 5.5% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.Revenue increased year-over-year in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, snapping a two-quarter streak of falling revenue. Revenue climbed 7.4% in the most recent quarter. Prior to that, it fell 4.2% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 0.5% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.

Wall Street is high on Weyerhaeuser (WY), expecting it to report earnings that are up 1000% from a year ago when it reports its first quarter earnings on Friday, April 26, 2013. The biggest boost for the company came in the second quarter of the last fiscal year, when profit jumped by 740%.
